text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT U S DEFICIT WITH NICs
text.author: By Claire Miller Reuters
text.body: The U S trade deficit Taiwan Korea expected to widen year despite some economic currency adjustments by two newly industrialized countries economists The surpluses Taiwan Korea ran U S get bigger time next year U S be screaming at those countries their exports Steve Cerier Manufacturers Hanover Trust Co Taiwan currently third biggest exporter to U S after Japan Canada while Korea seventh largest Faced heightened protectionist sentiment Congress Reagan administration been stepping up rhetoric against Taiwan Korea urging those countries to allow their currencies to appreciate lift impediments to free trade thrust shifted to those newly industrialized countries NICs amid signs dollar s steep drop against currencies Japan most EC nations previously main focus U S drive to cut trade gap beginning to close competiveness gap American goods U S Treasury secretary James Baker recently he expects reduction Japan s trade surplus year But U S manufacturers still losing markets on their own doorstep to Taiwan Korea whose currencies risen as much as yen mark As major beneficiaries soft oil prices low labor costs Taiwanese Korean exporters well placed to take up slack In fashionable comment Washington Japan bashing Now s NIC bashing Robert Chandross Lloyds Bank PLC Asia s four main NICs Hong Kong South Korea Singapore Taiwan accounted almost one fifth overall billion dlr U S merchandise trade deficit U S trade gap Taiwan rose to billion dlrs billion while bilateral trade deficit South Korea grew to billion billion preliminary U S data show growth trend continuing U S trade shortfall Taiwan billion dlrs January up pct year earlier gap Korea dlrs up pct year ago Lately both nations they take steps to defuse incipient trade tensions Korea choosing many items on U S wants to cut import tariffs order to deflect pressure currency revaluation Still South Korean trade minister Rha Woong Bae week Korea maintain trade surplus three to five years as way to cut billion dlr foreign debt part Taiwan January cut tariffs on goods sometime second half try to diversify exports But vice economic minister Wang Chien Shien month he still does expect Taiwan s trade surplus U S fall NICs made deep inroads into markets textiles electronic goods But Korea raising profile area big ticket manufactured goods notably cars Korea expects auto exports mostly North America to balloon to units zero The NICs exports almost all manufactured goods When their exports rise hits heart U S manufacturing base cuts directly to us to our customers Bob Wendt manager economic studies at Bethlehem Steel Corp U S takes pct Korea s computer products exports pct electrical appliances pct telecommunications equipment recent study by Morgan Guaranty Trust Co says Taiwan South Korea most pressing trade issue U S While Hong Kong Singapore run trade surpluses U S these offset by their deficits other countries But Taiwan to lesser extent South Korea stand marked contrast Both these nations moved rapidly into large bilateral surplus U S major overrall trade current account surpluses Morgan study says Morgan expects Taiwan s overall trade surplus to grow to billion dlrs billion year Korea s to increase to billion dlrs billion Concern NICs confined to U S A lot Korea Taiwan s exports to U S been at Japan s expense Richard Koss at General Motors Corp February s Paris meeting six major industrial powers exorted NICs to lower trade barriers revalue currencies But two pronged approach drawn little response two nations so far any case only work sizeable lag economists say U S how much thinks Taiwan s Korea s currencies should climb Taiwan dollar pegged to U S dollar risen pct since September while Korean won risen five pct But real terms Taiwan dollar been flat against U S unit won lost seven pct economists say We ve seen any lessening competition those countries we can attribute to currency changes Bethlehem Steel s Wendt so far U S pleas Taiwan Korea to use their hefty export earnings to import more little effect Moreover uncertain how far U S protectionism get given administration s free trade stance It s hard to see anything be passed much before year end then question teeth one economist

reuters.unknown: M f reute r f BC EC MINISTERS AGREE NE

text.title: EC MINISTERS AGREE NEED FOR BIG STEEL CLOSURES
text.author: By Gerrard Raven Reuters
text.body: European Community EC industry ministers today declared there need massive round closures steel plants to bring capacity country bloc into reasonable balance demand ministers were meeting to discuss plan voluntary plant closures drawn up by industry lobby group Eurofer calculates cost around jobs Diplomats their initial reactions to scheme most ministers declared useful basis discussion but did go nearly far enough Eurofer says identified scope closure plants annual capacity tonnes provided companies concerned can be fully repaid by EC or national governments redundancy other social costs But EC Executive Commission sources Industry Commissioner Karl Heinz Narjes told ministers today tonnes annual capacity excess to requirements should be closed by end He Eurofer plan particular fails to pinpoint scope closure heavy hot rolled wide strip products typically produced plants employing thousands people sources no minister challenged Narjes analysis four or five hot rolled wide strip lines to close They ministers agreed Eurofer plan should be expanded developed through meetings among industry body Commission representatives member states However diplomats clear today s discussions such meetings be difficult They member states split on whether to reduce scope quota production system at present protects EC steelmakers full force competition pct their products while talks on closure plan proceed also clear there be tough talks on EC member states should bear brunt closures on how much funding help to those thrown out work should come Community coffers German minister Martin Bangemann his country s steel industry largest EC should suffer proportionately more than others German sources But British diplomats their minister Giles Shaw insists profitability companies should be taken into account state owned British Steel Corporation benefitting massive recent write offs accumulated debts currently one few EC steel companies black Ministers were afternoon trying to agree joint statement on Eurofer plan situation industry

text.body: Repligen Corp intends to file investigational new drug application to Food Drug Administration seeking permission to test AIDS vaccine humans by early summer Repligen human tests could begin by end year We sufficiently encouraged impressed by work to date to go ahead clinical trial Michael Egan manager business development Repligen biotechnology company Repligen s Egan vaccine contains subfragment protein coat AIDS virus animal tests included primates Egan vaccine provoked neutralizing antibodies to AIDS virus broader cellular immunity Egan approach Repligen using to deliver vaccine using standard vaccine methods may be safer than vaccines using live smallpox virus to carry proteins found on surface coat AIDS virus Yesterday Bristol Myers Co BMY seek regulatory permission to test AIDS vaccine uses smallpox virus humans by end month Repligen s AIDS vaccine collaborative effort company Centocor Inc CNTO Duke University Medical School National Cancer Insitutes research teams directed by John Ghrayeb Centocor Scott Putney Repligen Dani Bolognesi at Duke Robert Gallo Flossie Wong Staal at National Cancer Institute Although there several AIDS vaccine candidates experts believe development safe effective vaccine long ways away Moreover seeking approval to test vaccine only first step long process verifying if vaccine actually prevent infection

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC JEFFERIES

text.title: SEC DETAILS CHARGES AGAINST JEFFERIES
text.body: Federal regulators Boyd Jefferies who resigned as head his Los Angeles brokerage firm took part schemes to manipulate price stock stock parking plot inside trader Ivan Boesky civil complaint filed U S District Court New York Securities Exchange Commission Jefferies agreed unidentified person to his firm buy up large chunk stock being issued public offering Under agreement firm Jefferies Co drove price stock up by one eighth point by buying four blocks stock at or near close trading SEC Jefferies Co s purchases unidentified stock accounted pct total trading volume stock on day were aimed at manipulation SEC complaint did identify company whose stock being traded but Jefferies Co purchases took place sometime year when another unidentified company owned controlling interest company sold several million shares stock secondary public offering stock purchases were made on New York Stock Exchange Pacific Stock Exchange SEC person who made alleged stock manipulation agreement Jefferies also identified But person later billed by Jefferies Co phony invoice marked investment banking services exact amount firm lost on deal when later sold stock on open market SEC payment amount also revealed complaint made later by another unidentified person after Jefferies sent second invoice lesser amount SEC firm recorded payment as other income William McLucas associate director enforcement at SEC declined to say why agency decided against revealing identities other persons companies involved stock manipulation scheme We just made determination way to go at time McLucas told Reuters complaint went into far greater detail charges Jefferies agreed Boesky to park stock at each other s firms Parking or warehousing stock refers to deals where stock held by one person or firm under arrangement where actually under control someone else Under agreement between Jefferies Boesky Jefferies Co hold stock owned by Seemala Corp one Boesky s brokerage firms days after Seemala buy stock back SEC Seemala realized all gains sustained all losses on stock held by Jefferies Co during period agreed to compensate Jefferies Co carrying stock to pay more than twice Jefferies Co s usual commission Seemala then agreed to hold stock owned by Jefferies Co month under terms same as deal Seemala agreed to park stock at Jefferies Co agreement violated several securities laws allowed Seemala to create false appearance no longer held stock could meet SEC s net capital requirements SEC Jefferies wanted Seemala to hold some stock SEC so Jefferies Co could meet net capital needs agency On March Seemala sold Jefferies shares oc Cooper Laboratories Inc dlrs shares Southland Financial Corp dlrs shares G D Searle Co dlrs On March Jefferies Co sold Seemala shares American Broadcasting Co dlrs shares Ideal Basic Industries Inc dlrs shares ITT Corp dlrs shares Phillips Petroleum Co dlrs shares Pioneer Corp dlrs shares Texas Oil Gas Corp dlrs SEC value Seemala s stock at time transfers dlrs while Jefferies Co s stock worth dlrs at time SEC Within month Seemala Jefferies Co unwound most stock transfers each others firms SEC But major hitch developed deal when price Searle stock Jefferies Co holding Seemala dipped sharply On March Seemala bought back Searle stock dlrs resulting dlr loss Jefferies Co SEC Seemala then allowed Jefferies Co to buy back some stock Seemala holding at dlr gain Boesky s firms later paid Jefferies firm three dlrs called fees Among violations Jefferies committed schemes were net capital record keeping public disclosure margin requirements SEC Under settlement civil SEC s charges announced simultaneously filing complaint Jefferies his firm did to admit or deny guilt But they agreed to court order barring them further securities law violations Jefferies also agreed to get out securities business at least five years

reuters.text: TIME TL SAYS IT WILL REFINANCE DEBT NEW YORK March Time Inc said it intends to make a cash tender offer for its mln dlr outstanding pct notes due October The price and other terms of the tender offer have not yet been determined the company said Time also announced its subsidiary Time Life Overseas Finance Corp NV intends to call for redemption all of its mln dlr outstanding pct guaranteed notes due January Time said it expects to fund the tender offer and redemption through one or more public issues of intermediate or long term debt It added a shelf registration statement for up to mln dlrs of debt securities to be used in part for the debt refinancing is expected to be filed in the near future Time said these moves are part of a continuing effort to reduce the average cost of its debt and to increase its financing flexibility Reuter

text.title: TRIPLE EXPIRATION MAY JOLT STOCK MARKET
text.author: By Andrew Stern Reuters
text.body: The stock market could be jolted one way or another on Friday as so called triple witching expiration raises specter volatile movement Dow Jones Industrial Average could soar or plunge as much as points or both or even remain static according to analysts stock stock index futures markets simultaneous expiration March stock index futures contracts options on these futures options on indexes themselves along options on individual stocks created mad scramble during several previous witching hours Upon expiration these vehicles investment managers must find place their funds past final hour seen tremendous surge New York Stock Exchange volume Analysts overriding influence stock market s steady climb year absence worthwhile investment alternatives may indicate major players look to buy into stock market as final hour transpires friday I think there be substantial swap out futures positions into stocks Jeffrey Miller Miller Tabak Hirsch Co But I ve got streak four or five row being right so I m bound to be wrong feeling among some analysts largest money managers do same thing they did at December s expiration when they plunged their multi billion dollar funds into stock market Last time during triple expiration there tremendous amount stock sold offset by huge buy programs late Donaldson Lufkin Jenrette Inc analyst William Marcus Some stock funds quickly place text.title: EASED RESTRICTIONS TO CREATE NEW PHONE SERVICES
text.author: By David Brough Reuters
text.body: Consumers may benefit new telephone services if business restrictions against regional Bell companies eased but safeguards against rate hikes may be needed congressional industry analysts say easing restrictions by U S District Court help bring new services to markets regional firms currently prohibited serving analysts say But consumer groups add there danger regional companies raise rates to subsidize entry into new markets safeguards be needed to prevent Brian Moir spokesman International Communications Association national group telephone users If there no safeguards there be higher rates less competition less consumer choice seven regional Bell companies created breakup American Telephone Telegraph Co T been prohibited by terms divestiture decree manufacturing equipment offering computerized information services or providing long distance service U S District Judge Harold Greene who presided over divestiture continues to enforce terms currently considering Justice Department recommendation to eliminate restrictions except on long distance service within Bell holding company s local service region separate filings week regional Bells asked Greene to remove restrictions while industry consumer groups including Consumer Federation America joined ATT asking all or most them be retained ATT pct share interstate long distance market filing oppose entry by Bell companies into computerized information services but against their participation long distance services manufacturing equipment ATT does offer computerized information services ATT asked Federal Communications Commission separate proceeding to reduce price rate regulations dominated long distance business many years Greene expected to reach decision on whether to ease restrictions year possibly summer analysts The restrictions prevent people who can provide services providing them congressional aide However major concern among consumer groups lawmakers companies may subsidize those new businesses higher charges to their customers We re talking activities funded directly or indirectly off backs ratepayers Moir One congressional aide he worried subsidizing new businesses profits but he concerned Bell companies may overcharge consumers so they can invest new services Some analysts accounting regulations protect consumers against cross subsidization by Bell companies Those types things really do need review Gerry Salemme aide House Telecommunications Consumer Protection Finance Subcommittee He added House hold hearings later year to examine potential effects reduced restrictions Gene Kimmelman Consumer Federation represents more than consumer groups accounting regulations were inadequate because accountants could separate equipment employed traditional new services We yet to see adequate regulatory safeguards exist prevent cross subsidization by Bell companies Kimmelman You re either asking great increases rates or great opportunity cross subsidization One congressional aide expressed concern lifting restrictions lead to joint ventures between U S foreign firms manufacturing telecommunications equipment could lead to loss American jobs He suggested some safeguards may be needed to protect against happening

text.author: By Geert Linnebank Reuters
text.body: Slower than expected growth Britain s narrow M money supply measure February help spur further cut U K Interest rates if surge sterling s value requires such move economic analysts M only targeted money supply measure left after Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson scrapped official target broad sterling M measure his budget speech on Tuesday fell adjusted to one pct February On annual basis put M growth at four to pct middle target two to six pct The M data much better than we expected Robert Thomas economist at Greenwell Montagu Securities He other analysts while better than expected M figures alone be sufficient to trigger new interest rate cut they removed obstacle to such move Thomas noted rise M been kept check despite buoyant retail sales February advancing adjusted pct after fall same size January Analysts M measure reflecting variations consumer demand rather than real inflation prospects adequate indicator to determine interest rates The authorities still seem to want to pretend M important practice likely to be exchange rate election call tune Lloyds Merchant bank chief economist Roger Bootle wrote budget comment Richard Jeffrey economist at stockbrokers Hoare Govett comment It unlikely Lawson respond to signals M alone Reinforcement exchange rate trends necessary before action taken With Chancellor making clear policy manoeuvres made response to signals narrow money variable City been forced to take seriously he added Noting point Thomas market fears at end year M overshoot now disappeared removed potential obstacle to further cut U K Base lending rates if foreign demand sterling pushed up pound above unofficial targets analysts Such targets believed to been secretly agreed between finance ministers Group Five Canada at their Paris meeting month they added U K Base rates been cut twice by half point since Paris agreement once on March again yesterday when foreign demand sterling surged reaction to sharp cut government borrowing targets contained budget They stand at pct now foreign exchange dealers analysts expect them to shed another half point coming week Analysts shrugged off as largely irrelevant higher than expected increase February sterling M pushed annual growth rate to almost pct well above previous target to pct Thomas February figures seemed to indicate improvement sterling M growth witnessed over past few months been reversed but firm conclusions could only be drawn after revised data released on March Some analysts foreign investors long ceased to watch sterling M target Lawson s move to scrap altogether earlier week removed whatever left credibility as key factor monetary policy

text.title: CONGRESSMEN URGE U S SOYBEAN PROGRAM CHANGES
text.body: Several leading farm state Congressmen they press U S Agriculture Department to implement some kind marketing loan to make soybeans exports competitive while protecting farm income Speaking at House grains subcommittee hearing chairman Dan Glickman D Kan proposed Congressmen representatives soybean growers meet USDA on subject next two weeks Let s see if we can try to push them USDA to do something without legislation Glickman told hearing current soybean loan rate effectively dlrs per bushel no income protection or marketing loan David Haggard American Soybean Association ASA president USDA must make changes soybean program current soybean program gave us worst both worlds ASA s Haggard told hearing loan rate too high relative to corn encouraging expansion soybean production South America he At same time U S soybean loan rate too low to provide any income support soybean farmers Haggard We need some kind market loan he added farm bill provides authority Agriculture Secretary to implement marketing loan soybeans but USDA so far resisted pressure to use authority Representatives ASA met earlier month USDA but Haggard USDA officials gave no indication if they seriously consider offering marketing loan USDA undersecretary Daniel Amstutz yesterday soybean situation dilemna been studied extensively by department But he did say what if any changes under consideration his testimony Haggard indicated there ways other than marketing loan should be considered to help soybean growers such as so called producer option payment or direct payment program Haggard barring any program changes Commodity Credit Corporation CCC soybean stocks now at bu rise to by end August further bu soybeans could be forfeited between September end year Thus CCC could own equivalent Brazil s entire soybean crop by end calendar year Haggard However Haggard U S should be cautious making soybean program changes might allow European Community to challenge U S program under General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT He noted EC imports one quarter U S soybean production loss market be devastating Reagan administration given mixed signals on whether believes marketing loan soybeans could be successfully challenged GATT by EC Haggard While ASA position to support dlrs per bu loan rate combined marketing loan Haggard also endorsed proposal by Rep Jerry Huckaby D La set six dlrs per bu loan rate apply marketing loan Huckaby proposal also supported by ranking Republican on House Agriculture committee Rep Edward Madigan Illinois Subcommittee chairman Glickman endorsed need to take some action on soybeans but cautioned marketing loan could mean substantial increase budget costs Glickman noted Agriculture Committee must cut one to billion dlrs fiscal budget therefore must fit any soybean program changes into overall budget Haggard at soybean loan rate six dlrs per bu combined marketing loan U S soybean price might fall to four dlrs per bu initially cost government maximum two billion dlrs But he costs decline as market prices recovered

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute r f BC MEXICO TO SIGN LOAN A

text.title: MEXICO TO SIGN LOAN AMID CALLS FOR CHANGE
text.author: By Alan Wheatley Reuters
text.body: Mexico s billion dlr loan package be signed New York tomorrow amid increasing calls both creditors debtors streamlining tortuous process raising such jumbo loans bankers Pressure change mounted because Mexican deal been even more difficult to syndicate than bankers feared Several tentative signing dates to be scrapped even now five months after loan agreed bank advisory committee on October dozens Mexico s some creditor banks worldwide still refusing to participate resistance to deal must be seen alongside fact largest loan Latin American debtor since region s debt crisis flared up Mexico also sign agreements to reschedule billion dlrs debt Moreover as first major package built on U S Treasury Secretary James Baker s strategy offering loans to countries willing to implement market oriented pro growth policies intense market scrutiny only to be expected Still split within banks ranks came as shock This unsuccessful operation but we ve more bickering than ever one senior banker commented Officers at small banks sold swapped or or written down their Mexican loans say they see no reason why they should throw good money after bad Major lenders counter small banks must share responsibility making new loans cannot expect to keep receiving interest on old debt unless they join new ones Assistant U S Treasury Secretary David Mulford recently reluctance small banks at one point endangered entire Mexican package Things improved but money center bankers determined to keep hounding recalcitrant banks even once billion dlr target been reached loan presently pct committed People who outside shouldn t think they ve been saved once we get over billion dlrs one warned But rounding up free rider banks entails such huge drain on management resources more more bankers acknowledging syndicates may to shrink One idea to levy new loan contributions on basis current exposure instead outstandings at earlier base date August case Mexico Another streamlining idea to allow small banks to escape by swapping their loans exit bonds debtor issue at discount Argentina pressed solution so far to no avail arguing smallest bank creditors account just one pct foreign bank debt next banks account only further six pct Central bank president Jose Luis Machinea Argentina may receive billion dlrs bank loans seeking until September be year after negotiations began International Monetary Fund protracted negotiations damaged confidence investors Argentina forcing up interest rates spurring capital flight he We to introduce some common sense into discussion Machinea week Cambridge Mass He echoed by Mexico s deputy planning minister Pedro Aspe Armella who delay signing his country s loan made difficult to map economic policy any certainty It s sad affair he told Cambridge meeting Bankers Mexico became so frustrated delay loan suspended debt equity swap program month to put pressure on banks Other strains intensified between U S non U S banks partly because U S regulations accounting rules discourage writedowns Critics say prompts U S banks to focus too much on ensuring steady interest payments debtors short term possibly to detriment longer term solutions Because more than half banks baulking at Mexican deal American some foreign bankers think other U S banks should make up difference issue national share defused on Mexican committee but bankers say probably recur talks Argentina Brazil whose finance minister Dilson Funaro already suggested separate negotiations regional committees creditors Streamlining new money process running parallel efforts to develop broader menu alternatives to new loans such as trade credits or debt equity conversions We must face fact greater flexibility devising new money packages may effect be essential to future bank syndications Mulford week He told banks to stop complaining there no leeway current procedures to come up ideas Some steps already been taken interest payments Chile been stretched out banks debating whether to accept partial interest payments Philippines paper instead cash Because banks want to isolate hard line Brazil by clinching deal Argentina as soon as practicable bankers Argentine package likely to be along established lines Baker Plan But some bankers speculating Brazilian deal when comes be radically different As such loan Mexico could go down history books as biggest but also jumbo I m convinced ll be one form one banker

text.body: Secretary State George Shultz decided to oppose any U S wheat subsidy offer to Soviet Union left final decision on whether to sell subsidized wheat to Moscow up to President Reagan Agriculture Department State Department official Shultz feels like he fought battle against subsidy summer he s going to mat again s now basically USDA who to make their decisions as to what they want to do official If USDA decides to go ahead subsidy offer to Soviet Union he Shultz wage vigorous campaign against He might come out favor but he won t go to President voice his objections official statement clarifying Shultz s remarks yesterday to leaders National Association Wheat Growers State Department Secretary Shultz expressed his belief whenever possible U S grain should be competitive on world markets including Soviet Union Agriculture Department best position to determine whether consideration should be given at time to extending to Soviets subsidy under Export Enhancement Program Although Shultz oppose wheat subsidy to Soviets there remain obstacles to another subsidy offer to Moscow State Department official Everyone government agrees if there subsidy to be offered we offer unless we firm commitment Soviets they buy USDA does want repetition summer when USSR baulked at offer four tonnes subsidized wheat official who asked to be identified Soviets rejected U S offer then on grounds dlr per tonne subsidy insufficient to bring U S prices down to competitive levels Soviets want higher subsidy offer time State Department source What Soviets want something equivalent to lowest price being paid by anyone world he Soviets argue they best customer U S they entitled to best price he Government commodity sources also there elements USDA most notably undersecretary Daniel Amstutz who remain opposed to wheat subsidy to Soviets Subsidized wheat to Soviet Union still foregone conclusion State Department official

text.title: EC OFFICIAL FAULTS U S TRADE BILL
text.body: Sir Roy Denman Head EC Delegation Washington pending U S trade legislation misguided attempt to deal nation s trade deficit spark retaliation if passed present form To think you can deal trade deficit by legislation mistake he told Foreign Trade Association here Denman told reporters possible retaliation he warned letter to House Ways Means Committee Chairman Dan Rostenkowski necessarily be on product for product basis Retaliation does to be matched product to product Denman He case textiles import restrictions however retaliation be against U S textile exports Certainly if restrictions were imposed on European exports textiles to U S Community be likely to retaliate restrictions on U S textile exports to Europe Denman He also took exception to U S proposals to require countries large current account surpluses U S to cut those surpluses or face special tariffs This conflict international obligations throw large wrench into current round trade negotiations could easily boomerang he warned tariff proposals Denman also took exception to U S efforts to seek reciprocity specific trade sectors Forcing reciprocity one sector by imposing barriers simply lead to retaliation other party he adding overall reciprocity can only be achieved by trading off disadvantages one sector advantages another

reuters.unknown: A RM f reute r f BC IMF OFFICIAL RESIGNS

text.title: IMF OFFICIAL RESIGNS CHARGING U S LOAN PRESSURE
text.author: By Alver Carlson Reuters
text.body: One top executives International Monetary Fund IMF tendered his resignation charging United States been pressuring agency to reduce conditions places on some loans monetary sources C David Finch Australian who heads IMF s exchange trade relations department told IMF executive board on Wednesday he planned to leave by end next month after years agency sources Finch statement considered unprecedented told board United States brought undue pressure on IMF to approve funding Zaire Egypt To resign manner highly unusual perhaps unprecedented monetary source Neither Finch nor U S IMF Representative Charles Dallara could be reached comment IMF since emergence debt crisis pressed many countries to tighten their belts cut back on social spending as conditions to granting assistance United States recently been taking position countries take needed economic reform measures relying more on market forces private enterprise should be encouraged by assistance IMF development banks Zaire under government President Mobutu Sese Seko recently been taking many reform measures designed to heal ailing economy IMF year approved month loan package Zaire totaling dlrs United States been considering possibility seeking access to military base Zaire but no decision been reached Egypt part been holding talks IMF aimed at reaching final accord on new one billion dlr loan package United States pressing quick deal according to sources However they tentative plan Egypt currently being reviewed by management Fund prior to going to executive board full approval raised number questions country s ability to repay Egypt also linchpin broad framework U S Middle East policy department headed by Finch among other responsibilties makes certain IMF policies loan conditions wielded evenly among countries Monetary sources United States brought pressure on IMF to approve loan package Mexico using economic conditions been broadly used before but Finch according to sources made no reference to Under debt initiative announced months ago by Treasury Secretary James Baker United States made decision debtor countries should be encourged to grow out their difficulties rather than rely on austerity measures He also recommended commercial banks provide billion dlrs new loans debtor countries while mutilateral banks add some six billion dlrs over three years key part proposal gave World Bank much greater role dealing debt crisis part because familiarity developing countries their problems initiative while widely heralded as good first step toward improving growing debt crisis viewed by some at IMF as rebuke previous austerity measures insisted upon by Fund return loans

text.title: FED DATA SUGGEST U S CREDIT POLICY IS ON HOLD
text.author: by Jeremy Solomons Reuters
text.body: Latest Federal Reserve data suggest U S banking system flush reserves going into period traditional tightness overall monetary policy on hold economists There ample liquidity Fed going to shift gears at present time or at least another month Maria Ramirez Drexel Burnham Lambert Inc Technical seasonal considerations aside there nothing credit market to get excited added Robert di Clemente Salomon Brothers Inc Adjusted bank borrowings Fed s discount window averaged only dlrs day first week bank statement period ending next Wednesday compared first weeks previous two periods Another sign abundant liquidity upward revision banks net free reserves two week period to March to daily average dlrs estimated Finally Fed spokesman told press briefing money center banks were absent Fed s discount window third week running latest week s borrowing split between large regional smaller banks While modest open market intervention apparently enough to defuse any funding compared March lowered water levels many rivers added resulted reduced hydro electric power causing shortages to industry households upper reaches Yangtze at their lowest levels century causing many early February New China News Agency average December temperature Harbin northeast six degrees higher than December degrees higher than December Severe drought affecting one third Sri Lanka threatens s wheat belt local Meteorological Bureau officials many farmers government officials fear while present low rainfall does yet pose major threat prospect dry autumn winter season when wheat crop early stages certainly does they added Concern heightened by memory drought devastated wheat crop coincided occurrence barely understood weather phenomenon known as El Nino they Although meteorologists cautious linking Asia Pacific region s disrupted weather patterns to any single cause El Nino s role being closely studied they Accu Weather Inc specialises providing data agriculture shipping interests each El Nino event unique El Nino does always produce same effects present occurrence much less pronounced than major event El Nino Spanish Christ Child because appears around Christmas formed by action warm air bearing clouds rain shifting Indonesian archipelago to coast Peru where mingles cold waters associated Peru current returns across Pacific as trade winds meteorologists winds strengthened by El Nino s pump effect raise sea level off Australia Indonesia they When winds drop ocean seeking equilibrium sends surge warmer water back across Pacific where collides cold seas off Peru they One effect heat exchange to deflect rain bearing clouds away Australia Indonesia into Pacific where they further disrupt other weather patterns prospects end to droughts vary Accu Weather coastal strip received less than half normal rainfall during current wet season but prospects increased rains diminishing as rainy season draws to end Sri Lanka drought come when rainfall should be at maximum year year s secondary rains usually occur between April June although possible at stage to forecast whether they arrive as usual

text.title: VOLCKER SAYS BRAZIL DEBT MOVE WILL NOT HURT BANKS
text.author: By Matt Spetalnick Reuters
text.body: Federal Reserve Board Chairman Paul Volcker suspension by Brazil foreign debt payments undermine U S Banks But he told Reuters after speech to educators interest U S Banks to complete debt financing plans soon Brazil other debtor nations I don t think s going to undermine public confidence banking system Brazil alone he But I like to see further progress made on whole situation Brazil announced month temporarily suspending interest payments on billion dlrs debt owed to private banks opening new round five year old debt crisis week Ecuador suspended interest payments to private foreign banks hold two thirds total billion dlr foreign debt citing severe damage to oil industry caused by earthquake Citicorp CCI largest U S Bank week might to reclassify most billion dlrs Brazilian loans as non performing thus removing them as part bank s expected income producing assets Analysts such move sharply reduce Citicorp s profits might result similar measures by Brazil s other bank creditors Volcker he believed Brazil Ecuador want to maintain continuity their debt service It s fundamentally their best interest If they can get financing refinancing s necessary they may be able to make their economies grow again Asked whether he expected other nations to follow path taken by Brazil Ecuador he two countries were special cases He did elaborate

text.title: WORLD BANK TEAMS STUDYING PHILIPPINE LOAN REQUESTS
text.author: By Chaitanya Kalbag Reuters
text.body: Two World Bank review teams Philippines to assess government requests funding expanded housing plan accelerated land reform program bank officials They told Reuters housing program loan request to dlrs government ask another dlr long term loan World Bank led consultative group multilateral bilateral aid donors to partially fund land reform program officials negotiations start next month on another dlr loan sought by Manila to carry out reforms major state owned corporations On Tuesday world bank approved two loans totalling dlrs to help country s economic recovery program bank also studying Philippine proposals loans to finance geothermal education projects sources World Bank sources bank s lending to Philippines since including latest loan totalled billion dlrs money been spread out over more than loans billion dlrs remains undisbursed World Bank sources bank cancelled dlrs loan commitments to Philippines during three years President Ferdinand Marcos s rule Marcos toppled by military civilian revolt February The loans were cancelled because projects slated aid were implemented properly they sources bulk week s loan be used to rehabilitate state owned Development Bank Philippines DBP Philippine National Bank PNB saddled seven billion dlrs non performing assets At least dlrs previously cancelled loans were supposed to go to DBP World Bank sources Over past three years bank s disbursement pipeline to Philippines almost completely dried up alone two banks paid out billion pesos loan repayments pct government s budget deficit billion pesos year they Agreement on latest loan reached principle September when President Corazon Aquino visited U S sources loan held up because delays by government submitting essential documents World Bank sources request land reform funding be discussed at meeting World Bank led consultative group to be held alongside April annual meeting Asian Development Bank ADB Osaka government land reform plan aims to distribute hectares land to impoverished peasants sources Philippine government estimated entire program cost billion pesos About billion long term cover land transfer costs borne mainly by landowners they The landowners be paid year bonds redeemable ten instalments sources bulk financing cover development costs land program help to bridge gap between year spread payments to landowners proposed year loan repayment period land buyers If you include interest total amount external assistance needed annually should exceed dlrs sources That volume aid does appear difficult They Japan World Bank ADB expected to provide most financing while Philippines bilateral aid donors contribute rest World Bank sources lending to Philippines designed to support balance payments position while government aims target six to seven pct annual gross national product growth Brazil did do homework one They pushed ahead recovery program without ensuring backing their balance payments position Manila being more cautious aims at soft borrowings hoped be outstripped by annual growth rates eventually result country emerging debt five or six years Philippine foreign debt currently billion dlrs

text.title: TROPICAL FOREST DEATH COULD SPARK NEW DEBT CRISIS
text.author: By Eric Hall Reuters
text.body: The death world s tropical rain forests could trigger new debt crisis social biological disasters scientists ecologists involved International Tropical Timber Organisation ITTO At stake ability developing nations including Brazil Mexico Philippines to service their debts loss trade worth hundreds billions dollars important sectors such as agriculture pharmaceuticals they experts gathering ahead ITTO meeting consumers producers near Tokyo next week problem already acute Philippines offers textbook case economic dangers For many third world nations loss forest just loss resources Delfin Ganapin Philippine government consultant on environmental impact In s we hectares commercial forest now we one We only around years profitable logging left billion dlr debt loss logging foreign exchange earnings serious he Philippine people depend on upland areas now denuded farmers cannot grow crops Government security advisers say as direct result most likely source revolution Philippines upland areas Ganapin Replanting uneconomic replanted tropical hardwoods less than pct chance survival There no known way to reproduce wood or millions species within No replanting programme been successful Almy Hafild Indonesian Network Forest Conservation Ganapin three billion dlrs be needed next two years alone to save five hectares critically denuded land Philippines experts say without major initiative development banks vicious circle continue countries cutting more forest to help service short term debts at cost long term insolvency Yet timber five billion dlr year industry necessarily most direct economic product forests nations must be educated how best to farm them Peter Kramer World Wildlife Fund WWF conservation director There four billion dlr annual global trade end products rattan Brazil nuts earn Brazil dlrs year he U S Pharmacologist Norman Farnsworth calculated pct all U S Prescriptions owe their active ingredients to higher plants growing forests Deforestation wipe out chance further discoveries force major corporations to research develop produce man made substitutes at cost scientists say incalculable By year only developing nations still be exporting timber currently their export earnings drop peak billion dlrs to less than two billion World Bank U N Sponsored survey billion dlrs advanced by World Bank Inter American African Asian Development Banks only dlrs went to forestry projects WWF statistics show half world s tropical forests vanished since s hectares remaining up to destroyed each year by destructive logging practises by local farmers

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC BRAZIL SEEN AS VANGUA

text.title: BRAZIL SEEN AS VANGUARD FOR CHANGING DEBT STRATEGY
text.author: By Keith Grant Reuters
text.body: Brazil s hard line debt stance though meeting creditor resistance boosting political initiatives Latin America aimed at broadening global strategy regional debt officials economic analysts say Now more than ever clear Latin America cannot pay under present conditions without sacrificing growth Peruvian President Alan Garcia referring to Brazil as debtors creditors prepare their annual meeting at Inter American Development Bank Miami next week region s debt crisis clearly coming to head Around billion dlrs commercial bank debt been rescheduled since interest rate margins now below one pct multi year accords norm no financial crash sight but lasting solution seems no nearer Virtually all Latin American leaders backed Brazil s suspension interest payments on billion dlrs private bank debt month though prospects chain default still remote Mexico Colombia Argentina others rejected such action Mexican finance minister Gustavo Petricioli merely Brazil having problems we sure be temporary But Brazil s action impact on other debt negotiations speeding agreement Chile Venezuela month influencing current talks Argentina Pressure new solutions built up on several fronts Philippines joining Brazil seeking interest relief Ecuador announcing force majeure on debt payments following serious earthquake Private banks being increasingly urged to renew lending accept innovative repayment schemes only by debtors but also by official agencies stepped up their own credit flows as part U S inspired plan One Latin American debt official he saw Brazil Ecuadorean announcements as spurring moves by other debtors to link debt service payments to macroeconomic indicators such as export earnings GDP or raw materials prices Despite debtor countries continue to accept case by case approach Cuba s call joint negotiating front being promoted by Brazil or even defended by Peru region s flag bearer unilateral payment decisions Each nation must negotiate debt independently according to own needs Brazilian foreign minister Ramiro de Abreu Sodre Caracas at weekend Venezuela s rapid agreement creditors soon after Brazil s move been seen by political opposition as betrayal debtor solidarity but de Abreu praised Venezuelan negotiators achieving favourable deal Argentina Bolivia Costa Rica others also pursuing normal negotiations creditor banks while at same time pressing hard better terms particularly lower interest rate spreads Latin American officials say while debt should be negotiated case by case their governments promoting general framework talks based on growth development priorities lower interest payments new financing The Brazilian Ecuadorean experience shows orthodox solutions to debt cases don t work senior Peruvian government official responsible debt affairs He saw growing likelihood other countries follow Peru s action setting pct debt payment limit face trade other factors beyond debtors control such as minimal bank lending These factors contributed to billion dlr net outflow Latin America five years Brazilian Finance Minister Dilson Funaro says Brazil alone paid back billion dlrs time received just billion loans Latin American debtors feel they complied their side bargain slashing public spending devaluing currencies cutting inflation privatizing state enterprises introducing debt equity schemes Brazil as region s biggest debtor most diversified economy now apparently adopted principle tough position creditors avoid more serious crisis later on We negotiating so debt question should be one continuous crisis Funaro told conference Rio de Janeiro week billion dlr debt burden year slim coffee prices plunging oil prices up but still well below levels interest rates beginning to rise Mexico expects one to two pct growth instead two to three pct projected earlier inflation near pct after pct year Brazilian officials expect growth only two pct after eight pct year pct drop projected trade surplus while independent estimates put inflation at pct Political economic analysts Brazil believe payment suspension give new impetus to tackling regional crisis though they expect protracted negotiations view echoed by senior international bank officials Some banks including Citibank Morgan Guaranty Bank America already preparing to downgrade their Brazil loans Brazil s refusal to accept IMF program condition set by many banks new lending meanwhile reflects view most Latin American governments equate Fund recession But Brazil Venezuela only countries region to rescheduled debt without IMF program

reuters.unknown: V f reute u f AM REAGAN RDLD WRITETH OUGH

text.title: REAGAN DEFENDS IRAN DEAL BUT WOULDN T REPEAT IT
text.author: By David Nagy
text.body: President Reagan staying cool under televised grilling on Iran contra scandal insisted he told all he knows crippling affair he do all differently given second chance No I go down same road again president night during minute news conference his first exactly four months when asked if he again sell arms to Iran hopes freeing U S hostages Middle East But he added I ll keep my eye open opportunity again improving relations we continue to explore every legitimate means getting our hostages back As expected televised conference almost completely dominated by questions secret sales U S arms to Iran diversion funds to contra rebels Nicaragua investigators standpoint toughest question concerned year old Reagan s knowledge contra operation As expected president repeatedly stated now calmly now some fire he knew nothing scheme to been run by White House National Security aide Oliver North since fired knowledge presidential adviser John Poindexter now resigned No true at all president replied sternly when asked report Poindexter told him twice secret channeling millions dollars to contras When I went on air right after news broke about Iran arms deal November I did know at time there any money involved He he learned contra diversion may broken U S laws be top priority congressional investigative hearings on affair only when Atty Gen Edwin Meese told him on November Just as important Reagan s standpoint however manner he handled his first non scripted public accounting scandal since details first began leaking out November plunged his administration into deep political crisis He appeared to bring off without major stumbles abetted by press corps seemed at pains to maintain civil manner until very end when crowded round him trying to get one question as he leaving rostrum White House East Room He often responded slowly deliberately but never seemed at loss words or vintage Reagan mannerisms At one point contra discussion he furrowed his brow puzzlement as he he just as mystified as everyone where all unaccounted millions gone Iran arms sales I m still wanting to find out source all extra money bank accounts where extra money went he At another point he laughed off question on whether he might been told contra connection forgotten saying Oh no pausing to chuckle adding You d heard me without opening door to my office if I d been told

major nations considering Organisation Economic Cooperation Development OECD staff report forecasts continuing large Japanese trade surplus they Though Japanese exports become more expensive yen s sharp rise against dollar they still tend to surge when growth picks up according to OECD As solution OECD staff urged Japan to redirect export driven economy boosting domestic demand imports by reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC EC AND COMECON ENDS T

text.title: EC AND COMECON ENDS TALKS WITH PROGRESS
text.author: By Stephanie Nebehay Reuters
text.body: The European Community EC Soviet led Comecon ended talks here having made progress on setting up formal trade relations but no breakthrough because Comecon s refusal to recognise West Berlin as part EC delegates Negotiators were trying to reach agreement on draft joint declaration setting up official relations after years mutual non recognition John Maslen head EC delegation told Reuters as he emerged final session We made some progress but we called another meeting Officials who asked to be named Comecon team refused to accept clause draft declaration recognise West Berlin as part nation EC Under Treaty Rome all contracts agreements signed by Community must contain territorial clause stipulating West Berlin integral part EC EC negotiator taking part three day talks We wanted territorial clause but Comecon no joint statement issued after talks progress made towards clarifying positions but another meeting be necessary to complete work Any decision principle to set up relations require approval by Community s Council Ministers by executive committee Comecon Zdzislaw Kuroski deputy director Comecon who heads East bloc delegation told Reuters ahead today s session We narrowed our differences on range questions but on all questions Asked whether Comecon accept EC insistence any joint declaration stipulate West Berlin as part Community he replied This question contained draft our side presented West German diplomats they insist on including clause on West Berlin any EC Comecon agreement talks followed earlier round between two trading blocs here September first ever direct talks between EC Soviet Union on establishing diplomatic relations January EC trades individual Comecon member states despite non recognition Comecon year EC five billion dlr trade deficit East European states half deficit previous year due to drop price Soviet oil imported by EC

text.body: Companies henceforth be able to own stakes banks but these should constitute dominant holding Italian government committee ruled Interministerial Committee on Credit Savings headed by Treasury Minister Giovanni Goria decision reflected need to safeguard principle separation between banks non financial concerns did quantify what might constitute dominant holding committee also set conditions allocation credits by banks to companies or individuals holding stakes them stipulates conditions under Bank Italy could exercise powers control case stakes held by banks companies or other banks Under ruling credits given by banks or their subsidiaries to groups or individuals holding five pct or more bank s capital must exceed defined limits value credits given cannot exceed either one fifth combined capital reserves bank itself or two fifths value stake owned bank by group or individual concerned Exceptions to these conditions include credits to concerns bank itself stake to branches foreign banks Credits made by foreign companies or banks to subsidiaries their legal base Italy also be excluded conditions Bank Italy request banks to insert rules their statutes to ensure companies or individuals holding five pct or more bank s capital given privileged treatment regard to credit allocation terms regard to bank holdings companies Bank Italy can exercise supervisory controls when information on bank s consolidated activities show single shareholdings company or another bank pct or more owned directly or indirectly Such controls can also be exercised even if stake held below pct if can be considered controlling interest controls be exercised cases where value bank s stake concern below lesser two predefined limits These limits set at billion lire or two pct total assets parent company shareholding bank

U S AZT or azidothymidine be marketed as Retrovir by company U S arm Britain s Wellcome PLC Because limited supply FDA drug be restricted initially to those patients AIDS or AIDS related complex today s action means significant medical relief be available to thousands those afflicted disease Retrovir cure but demonstrated ability to improve short term survival AIDS patients recently diagnosed text.body: A new International Natural Rubber Agreement INRA formally adopted by United Nations Conference today new accord due to replace current one expires October Conference chairman Manaspas Xuto Thailand formal adoption represented a historic moment latest round talks began March represented fourth attempt to negotiate new INRA nearly two years Xuto described negotiations as by no means easy we often faced problems new pact due to enter into force provisionally when ratified by countries accounting pct world net exports pct net imports new INRA enter into force definitively when governments accounting at least pct net exports pct net imports ratified be open signature May to December year expected provisional entry into force take at least to months now delegates During hiatus between two agreements buffer stock operations be suspended but International Natural Rubber Council remain place Xuto told conference both agreement successor were aimed at meeting needs producers consumers natural rubber over long term Both interest stabilising prices supplies Xuto added He also praised the spirit give take prevailed throughout session Ahmed Farouk Malaysia speaking on behalf producers conclusion new pact showed mutuality interests between producers consumers now as valid as when negotiations first agreement began s Farouk ability to manage inventories on basis predictable stable prices a vital consideration multinational tire companies whether or consuming countries as whole claimed to be no longer so seriously concerned security rubber supply He producers considered agreement served purpose created Farouk urged consuming countries to promote early accession to new pact to avoid undue gap between old new Gerard Guillonneau France speaking consumers agreed agreement worked relatively well But as economic conditions changed he consumers been led to make proposals improving functioning He added adoption new agreement attests to importance rubber confidence rubber industry

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute u f BC MEXICO WARNS OF WORSE

text.title: MEXICO WARNS OF WORSENING THIRD WORLD DEBT WOES
text.author: By Alan Wheatley Reuters
text.body: High interest rates sluggish global economic growth creeping protectionism deepening third world debt crisis senior Mexican officials Finance minister Gustavo Petricioli today s signing billion dlr new loan rescheduling package Mexico most comprehensive far reaching effort debt management yet achieved sovereign borrower But remarks prepared signing ceremony he warned against complacency The debt problem solved If anything been exacerbated by recent events The inequities international economic environment conspire against welfare stability developing countries Petricioli added debt problem be solved unless developing countries allowed to grow he argued There be no solution without further development trade throughout world Director public credit Angel Gurria told reporters Mexico s economy should resume growth year but he external conditions favorable Latin America grappling adverse terms trade instance as underlined by recent slide coffee prices Interest rates remain unacceptably high real terms Gurria added Inflation literally disappeared face earth industrialized world but interest rates still near seven pct Industrial powers must also improve coordination their economic policies to boost unacceptably low growth rates to keep export markets open Gurria who Mexico s chief debt negotiator officials also blunt warning those banks refuse to participate loan package Do expect to get much business Mexico future Mexico s or so creditor banks worldwide still to join loan but four more acceptances were received today according to senior Citibank executive William Rhodes who co chairman Mexico s advisory committee Those who supported us today can be sure Mexico continue to be open willing to share them business opportunities future growth create Those few who denied their responsibility turned their backs on remarkable effort international cooperation on financial system on their enlightened colleagues Petricioli One way Mexico could punish recalcitrant banks be to deny or at least slow down applications to convert Mexican debt into equity investments within country We be lot more expeditious processing requests banks supported us Gurria adding We long memories Debt equity conversions attractive way banks to provide clients subsidized pesos investment Mexico to collect handsome brokerage fees or reduce their own Mexican exposure process growing popularity scheme underlined week when American Express Bank joined new Mexican package plans to convert dlrs own loans into equity stake hotel projects Mexico Mexico halted debt equity program on Feb to force banks to concentrate on wrapping up financing pakcage Gurria resume once first part six billion dlr loan forms core deal disbursed loan now pct subscribed Gurria Mexico hopes to close books by middle April time drawdown by end April Although agreements were signed sumptuous surroundings midtown Manhattan hotel atmosphere signing ceremony rather subdued bankers officials showing little elation relief normally follows conclusion mammoth deal After five months arduous work syndicating loan debt fatigue apparent talk ways to make financing process less cumbersome This package been harder than all others I hope we find way s so debilitating people who to put them together Gurria

text.title: CONCERN OVER EL NINO IN PERU USDA REPORT
text.body: There heightened fears El Nino may be returning to Peru intensity approaching disaster affected weather on several continents caused widespread damage through floods drought U S Agriculture Department s officer Lima field report Continued heavy rains northern coastal area flooding several major rivers mud slides led to increased concern report dated March However official sources still believe year s El Nino only weak to moderate intensity EL Nino phenomenon involving shift winds waters pacific USDA report so far El Nino now being experienced overall negative impact on agricultural production Excessive rains Piura Pima cotton area may reduce yields by pct due to excessive growth too early crop cycle Also insect damage to crops could be more extensive where excessive moisture exists However El Nino resulted much improved supply irrigation water major dams improve prospects many crucial crops such as rice corn slow decline sugar production If El Nino picks up momentum Peru s fishing industry could receive setback But trade sources still believe fish catch industrial processing reach tonnes almost pct above year report Water temperatures northern fishing areas three to four degrees centigrade above normal but still high enough to drive fish to cooler southern waters there still outside chance El Nino intensify carry on through late March April May causing problems as crops approach harvest There appears to be no way to project course El Nino only time tell report
